Of course, the main reason we stayed at ABaC was for the restaurant.  I admit we had been dying to stay at your hotel, so check that one off the bucket list.  But we also LOVE Jordi Cruz restaurant at ABaC!  The service, superb!  The waitstaff knows almost everything about the food, the wine, the preparations, herbs and spices, to the seasoning and cooking of each dish.  Very professional and well trained, friendly as well.  You can also feel the joy the servers and expeditors have in working in such a fine restaurant.  It's easy to tell they are happy, which makes the experience that much more memorable.
I recommend having one of the tasting menus, that way you can really experience the mastery of the kitchen that Jordi has instilled into each dish.  Each a work of art, and full of inspiration!!  Delicious to boot, it's a win, win!!!

Title: Beautiful
Text: It was all that l expected ,beautiful and serene.Loved the reception ,service and the  food was great.Good location easy access by car or hop-in-tour bus.I loved the glass walled shower room where you can still watch the TV whilst having a shower (or draw the curtains if you wish).A must stay again when in Barcelona and would recommend.

Title: Top Ten Epic Experience
Text: 16 courses over 4.5 hours with wine pairing.  Each dish carefully crafted and presented with precision.   All four of us agreed that this restaurant had the qualities of an easy top ten experience for us.  Attentive staff, excellent overall service and amazingly created chef.  Only comments from the two women were that they found a couple of the dishes a little too fishy for their liking.   But we are in Barcelona and the other parties found the fish dishes to be excellent.  The decor is contemporary and could be interpreted as sterile, but that was the vibe at ABaC.  Sleek and detailed.   So a definite thumbs up for a special night out!

Title: Awesome!
Text:
We went this April to the Abac-restaurant in Barcelona and were very satisfied. 

Pros:
- Friendly/Professional staff
- Cuisine at a very high level but not through the whole menu
- Nice interior 
- Rather "private" tables, with enough spacing between 

Cons:
- One or two courses weren't as creative as they need to be in my opinion

Title: Amazing... Plan to go back
Text:
The staff were amazing, responsive to our every need, many great suggestions to explore the city and super friendly. The hotel is very stylish with great decor. We enjoyed the tasting menu dinner with wine pairings... Heavenly. 

Probably the most comfortable bed we have slept in.

Title: I would love to eat here every week because the food is delicious and surprising.
Text: The food is so delicious and surprising that I would like to eat here every week. The service is impeccable and de sommelier was able to recommend a very good cava based on our preferences. We had a great evening out and came home late but happy. The restaurant is based north of the centre of Barcelona, just a taxi ride away from our house / your hotel. You do have to make a reservation well in advance.

Title: Your Luxury Home in the City
Text: From the very first moment of booking, to the very last moments of farewell, this hotel was a complete joy. The location is excellent with easy access to the city's public transport system and so to its great sights and attractions. It is also secluded, set in its gardens and grounds, a world away from the hubbub of one of Europe's most dynamic cities. The rooms are superbly equipped and furnished, offering the highest level of comfort and amenity. The hotel's facilities are comprehensive and impressive. The staff are super-helpful - nothing is too much trouble. You will feel safe and well looked after here.

Title: Amazing hotel, excellent staff and customer service
Text: I stayed at Abac Hotel for 3 nights during my Europe trip and it is an experience I truly recommend. Amazing staff, excellent customer service especially the helpful and cheerful reception team and wonderful facilities. Rooms are very comfortable and to the high levels expected, a 5 star treatment above all.

Title: Spanish Auberge
Text: Staying at ABaC  in Barcelona on Jan.18, 2015. I felt comfortable like my home during staying at my room in ABaC with  good hospitality by the young staffs.  I enjoyred sleep on the huge bed. From 9pm, the dinner at 2 michelin restaurant, by the very famous chef, Jordi Cruz. Marvelous dinner. 人気のミシュランシェフ、Jordi CruzのレストランとHotel。少し部屋の扉が重いですが、居心地いいHotelでした。

Title: Speechless
Text: I will never forget my experience in ABaC! I am simply in love. If I could I would repeat it everyday! From the design of the hotel, the food, the Chef(omg) till the service everything was taught about to perfection! The elaborated cuisine that was served was beyond my expectation , every dish was taking us to another level of cuisine. Every dish is well explained, the waiters are these to serve you with a smile on their faces. The amazing chef Jordi Cruz is always there to make sure that we had a great experience and to share with us our special dinner. Honestly I cannot add more because as I said I am speechless. You have to visit and see for yourself! Enjoy

Title: Could have been better.
Text: After a 3 night stay in the hustle and bustle of city centre Barcelona we decided to spend our final evening at ABaC for my birthday.  We were very glad that we did this as this small boutique type establishment is well away from the city centre in a rather nice leafy suburb.  It is a rather blocky modern building which is not entirely easy to navigate but that was neither here not there.  Check in was a bit long and drawn out but a welcome glass of iced water followed by a cool glass of Cava in our room was most acceptable. The room was a fair size with large and very comfortable bed, mini bar, espresso machine and well designed bathroom with spa tub, seperate toilet and bidet and rain shower. The shower however, was not great because the taps were on the far wall and you had to get completely soaked in very cold water to turn it on and then adjust the temperature....I got in the tub instead while my husband persevered...successfully in the end.  We took our glasses of Cava to the outside terrace by the restaurant and thoroughly enjoyed the afternoon sunshine for an hour or so.  We had been anticipating dinner, for which they have achieved 2 Michelin stars, and had the longer tasting menu.  We also opted for the wine pairing and at 85 euros per person we had high expectations.  Perhaps we were a little jaded having eaten at 2 one star and one 3 star restaurant in the previous 3 days but we thought it just lacked a beat.  The service was acceptable but completely without passion or enthusiasm and as we rate all our significant restaurant outings we certainly thought that there were one or two things that should not have been on the menu, like the sea lettuce & oysters in aspic...needs improvement.  The wine pairing in general was quite good but I did not think the sake was a great choice though my husband disagrees and the 2 dessert wines were a little over sweet. The wine flight was also by far the most expensive we had so our expectation was for better.  My advice would be to stick with a bottle of white, perhaps an Albarino or Godello to go with all the fish & a glass of red for main course, with a glass of port or dessert wine for the sweet things.  The Chinese bread, Thai Coral, Roasted onion juices & Pigeon however were all excellent. We would come back again, perhaps staying here first instead of last.

Title: In serious need of improvement
Text: This hotel is well past its prime time. We spent one night looking for exquisite comfort and surroundings and found a dated place (its glory might've been 2009!) in serious need of some TLC. We were left under the impression that either the place is going to be sold soon, a refurbishment is already planned (therefore the decor oversights and the lack of a good management) or else it's just plain average. Doesn't deserve the current 5 start GL hotel rating whatsoever.

Title: Bitterly Disappointing
Text:
We spent many hours trawling TA for the perfect place to stay in Barcelona for our New Year mini break and finally opted for ABAC. Having now stayed there for three nights, its position, number 10, is either unjustified or the competition must be quite dreadful.

The hotel has good transport links and is only a few metres away from the Avenue Tibidabo Metro Station, at the top of Line 7. The journey to the city centre, Catalunya, is approximately 10 minutes by Metro (2 Euros 15 cents) or 15 minutes in a taxi (approximately 12 Euros). There is also a taxi rank opposite the hotel.

I understood that the hotel was in a quiet suburb, however, it is in fact located on a busy main junction. 

Upon our arrival, in the early hours of the morning, we were escorted to our room, via a working kitchen which had a foul smell of cooked fish. The short experience made me and my partner feel quite sick and made our clothes smell. Whilst the hub of the hotel is undoubtedly the restaurant, and some may be impressed at the sight of the inside of a kitchen, others, like us, would prefer to avoid such an experience.

As we entered the room, it was unbearably hot and it would appear the heating controls of the room are operated remotely as it took many hours for the temperature to fall to an acceptable level. The receptionist made the necessary adjustment without attending our room.

The tap in the bathroom dripped all night and we were woken at 07:00, just a few hours after our arrival and a very long journey, with sunshine streaming into the room because the automatic blinds were defective and would not close. Further, there was an extremely loud revving noise. We reported these matters repeatedly to reception and at one stage it was necessary for me to get dressed and walk to reception as no one was answering the hotel telephone. At no stage did the hotel offer an apology and simply said words to the effect that "maintenance would look at the problems later." The blind was shut with Velcro the following day but the dripping tap was never fixed so we ended up putting a towel under the tap to stop the noise.

The bedroom was cleaned twice every day to an immaculate standard. The bed is a good size and fairly comfortable with the mattress topper provided. The lighting is excellent in the room. One strange feature, as other members have commented upon, is the absence of complimentary water in the room. All the more so when mineral water and fruit juices are complimentary in the spa.

The bathroom had a large walk in rainfall shower but unfortunately the bathroom floor flooded each time one had a shower. It was clear from the state of the door frame that this had been a problem for some time. The smashed floor tiles in front of the shower ought to have been repaired, however, again they had clearly been in that state for some time. The toilet and bidet were set within a sleek mirror glass cube room. The jet bath was far too small and ridiculously narrow and so it was impossible to have a relaxing soak.

The spa had a tiny warm pool with metal spa beds, a steam room and two loungers. Fortunately when we went to the area there were no other guests present, however, if more guests had arrived the area would have felt very crowded and claustrophobic.  

Upon check out, the hotel announced that it was closing its doors for a week as they were aware of the problems, such as the flooding of the showers. We made no further comments as Agoda, who have excellent customer service, had given us a goodwill gesture as a result of the problems we had had at the hotel. As others have commented, the reception team are entirely disinterested and fairly arrogant.

Title: Fabulous boutique hotel
Text:
A real find ,personal service,well appointed rooms,world class restaurant, all within the heart of Barcelona! We arrived in time for lunch.They had a beautiful garden ,serving lunch outside ,   service and the meal were outstanding.
Dinner in their fine dining restaurant was also amazing as was their wine list!

Title: Birthday Surprise!
Text: My husband treated me to lunch and a night's stay at ABaC hotel for my birthday. Though we live in Barcelona, our stay felt as if we were in a different city. I was in bliss after we arrived and were so attentively treated by all the waitstaff and hotel management. The lunch cuisine was phenomenal, and the presentation stunning. The restaurant atmosphere has a tranquil sophistication, so you feel really comfortable savoring the dishes brought to you in such a spectacular style. These waitstaff are uber chic in their black suits. Our suite was very comfortable and fell into deep slumber after enjoying the spa downstairs. I recommend ladies make an appointment for the Debra Mitchell facial. My face was glowing and rejuvenated after my facial massage with bee venom. This hotel is highly recommended for couples who want exquisite cuisine and and pampering.

Title: A nice stay
Text: We stayed at the ABaC hotel for 1 night after a cruise. The hotel is quite a bit out from the city centre so be prepared to use taxis or buses to get around as it's too far to walk to the main hub. The rooms are beautiful and are well equipped and are extremely comfortable. We didn't get an opportunity to eat at the restaurant but did have drinks in the outside garden area. I feel the drinks menu is quite limited and after a long day sightseeing we thought we would try room service but after looking at the menu the options were limited. The staff were helpful but I don't think I would return as would prefer to go for a hotel nearer to the city centre.

Title: One of my best experiences!
Text: At first, it was to enjoy the food. Then once I realised that I will be transported by the tasting menu to another level that I decided to stay in not to carry my tummy. Best decision that I did for my BCN days!

Title: Wonderful Penthouse, great staff but does need a refresh !
Text:
We arrived to a very warm greeting and afterwards a tour of the hotel ! 
Its a bit bizarre having to walk through the kitchen to get to your room especially when they are in full service and the kitchen smells in the lift ...especially when there is fish on the menu

That aside the Penthouse is a great suite ...stunning views and the terrace is amazing - the furniture is modern & minimalistic ...nice but is showing signs of wear and tear including in the bathroom which should not be the case when you are paying these tariffs - however we still really enjoyed it but I would suggest a touch up is in required !!!...oopps how could I forget to mention the bed ....total BLISS! best nights sleep ever    

Breakfast is great and the lady who serves is just the most wonderful lady you could ever wish to meet!...even for those who don't like mornings she could make them smile - I'm sure ! 

Its really easy to get in top Barcelona centre, out of the front gate and onto the underground and the tickets of 10 - which you can legitimately share too are great value - it takes 10 minutes 

All in all a nice stay! Thank you

Title: A Quality Stay
Text:
We received a warm welcome, a tour of the hotel and facilities and finally a helpful indication of places to visit. The room (Deluxe) was spacious and comfortable. Great "rainwater" style shower and jacuzzi tub. Mirrors and glass walls everywhere. Nice B&O TV but pretty useless if you only speak english (fortunately the free wifi is fast enough to support Sky Go/Netflix if like us, you need an occasional fix). I've read previous reviews that mention the great breakfast. There is no doubt  the food was quality, but I do like my full english ..and that wasn't an option. The eggs were fabulous and there is still plenty to eat.  The hotel is very quiet. Only 15 rooms and we only ever saw the occasional couple at breakfast. A very quiet hotel. Very secure and good location; the metro is across the street and runs into Rambles every 7 minutes. The tram and buses are outside the hotel gate. We didn't eat in the restaurant. It's very expensive and I have a limited taste for food so wouldn't appreciate it i'm sure. We couldn't find a decent restaurant in the area but go to Province just 6 minutes away on the Metro and there are some excellent ones to choose from.
So overall, a lovely hotel. We stayed 7 nights but I think this is more suited to 2 or 3 nights. My wife missed an outdoor pool for early evening relaxation with her book. Would recommend it though, just don't expect to meet many people.

Title: Lovely
Text:
Great rooms,lovely setting,helpful staff,peaceful but with easy access to everything and the crowning glory of a well deserved 2 star michelin restaurant.........hard to beat
For what is delivered the price is very reasonable.

Title: Wonderful stay
Text: I could not rate this hotel highly enough.  From the beginning correspondence with the concierge was easy and they were most helpful.  Check in was a breeze and they kindly let us check in early.  The room was perfect, spacious and very quiet. Being a boutique hotel, we never ran into other guests, which made our stay feel very private. The hotel is so close to train station and would only take 10mins to get to the centre of town. All staff were lovely to deal with, even when there was a problem with our room key they kindly offered us a glass of wine of their deck while it got sorted. The only thing would be was we wish we could have stayed longer.

Title: Just perfect :)
Text:
Excellent customer service, spoke very good English with good spacious room and facilities. 
We were greeted by smiling faces readily to help us with our bags on our way in and an excellent staff member who gave us a good background on Barcelona must see spots, followed by an introduction of the hotel and our room. 
We only stayed for a night as it is our last destination of our trip but will definitely be back on our next trip to Barcelona. 
Our only comment to the hotel is to provide bottled water and free minibar. 
This is rather common practice for most other boutique hotels we have stayed IN and will only top off the wonderful experience you have already provided.

Title: Amazing ABaC
Text: My husband and I spent the UK August Bank Holiday weekend here and just loved it.  Our bedroom was lovely and well supplied with premium toiletries and nice touches such as a free hairbrush.  The bed was supremely comfortable and everying was very clean.  The hotel is very well situated.  Its out of the centre of town but the open top tour buses stop right outside and there is a metro station directly across the road.  The metro from Tibidabo runs every 15 minutes and its 5 stops straight into Placa de Catalunya.  There is also a little open air bar over the top of the metro station which turned out to be a lot nicer than we first thought it would be for an evening cava.  Breakfast was not included in the price of our room and, althought it was nice, its a fairly expensive €28 a head so you may wish to head into town and grab a Starbucks.

Title: Excellent
Text: The hotel is secluded and private: you almost may not notice it upon first approach. Our room was spacious and decorate nicely. Also a nice lounge bed inside the patio. A good size bathroom with rain shower and separate bath as well as nice products rounded everything off. The location feels more remote than it in fact is, the metro/suburb stops literally across the street and there is a frequent service to Placa Catalunya (15 minutes), although later in the evening the services becomes rather infrequent (3x per hour). We enjoyed a great breakfast in the garden as well as a wonderful dinner in the restaurant. The hotel staff could be a bit more “out there” – it is very possible to not meet anyone apart from check-in/out and sometimes one feels a little bit like an intruder rather than a guest, especially when taking the needed walk from the hotel side to the restaurant through the kitchen and literally none of the kitchen staff responds to your “good morning” or “good evening” (the same with the room maid). Overall a very pleasant stay but they could do more to be as good of a hotel as a restaurant.

Title: Beautiful hotel, fabulous food
Text: I stayed here four nights, and it was so luxurious and comfortable! Large room, facing beautiful garden, plus very fancy bathroom with rainfall shower and jetted tub. The breakfast, which came with the room, was one of the best I've ever had in a hotel. The hotel is about a 15-20 minute metro ride from La Rambla and all the tourist activities, but I found it nice to come back to a quieter area. The only downside is there are not as many restaurants in the area, and the hotel restaurant is very fancy, not for everyday dinners. Highly recommend though!

Title: Excellent, and slightly peculiar hotel.
Text:
Having been to Barcelona in the past, and having camped in the usual luxury hotels, I decided to book my anniversary trip somewhere special, and after some research I decided that the Penthouse Suite at the ABaC Barcelona would be a fantastic idea.
And so it was.

When making the reservation online I was already offered the possibility of adding fresh fruit, flowers, and champagne (all of it at a fair enough cost), so there was less to worry about later on.
The only two requests I had before my arrival, swiftly resolved by email with outstanding professionalism and courtesy, were the prepayment of the room (to avoid possible issues with credit cards being flagged for fraud), and a reservation at the amazing ABaC restaurant, which is part of the hotel (and an aboslute must if you stay there. The chef is a young gentleman named Jordi Cruz who recently won some sort of MasterChef Spain programme, and the property has deservedly received a 2** Michelin rating).

The hotel is located in the northernmost area of Barcelona, along an avenue full of expansive mansions, some new, some old.
Transportation to the centre of the city is very easy through a light-train (similar to the subway) barely 100 years from the hotel, a bus that stops on the very corner of the hotel, or taking a cab at the taxi stand that's at the other side of the roundabout (barely around 10 euros, usually less).

The property is very interesting. It looks like it was designed to resemble a modern mansion designed by Frank Lloyd Wright (I'm guessing... my knowledge of modern architecture is scant). With only 7 or 8 rooms, it could perfectly pass for a huge private house.
Access to the wooden-gated grounds is first achieved through a camera-doorbell (after check-in, an RFID card is given that'll open your room door and the huge gate).
The Front Desk is one floor below, but a friendly smiling woman came up to greet us to the grounds and take us down to the elevator and introduce us to our Front Desk agent, another friendly and excellently mannered woman whom, after the check-in, guided us through a small tour of the hotel to our room, and showed us the room itself.
The design of the hotel allows for guests (I don't know if only the ones staying in the Penthouse Suite or all, sincerely) to walk right through the kitchen to get outside. It's an interesting and mouth-watering experience.

Our room was spacious but not specially big (for a Suite). In fact, the design was more like Junior Suite: King sized bed, and large living space with a couch, coffee table, working desk, and large flatscreen TV in the same room (as usual, we didn't even turn it on, so can't say a word about the cable options). The bathroom was modern and large, with a separate shower and a jetted bathtub (though both enclosed in the same glass structure) with very nice gender-personalised amenities and toiletry kits, and separate WC enclosure. All the furniture was new and impeccable.
One whole side of the room was floor-to-ceiling glass panes (which can be partially or totally blacked-out by motorised curtains)... and then came the room's jewel: the terrace. Or, rather The Terrace.
That has to be a 850sqmt terrace at the very least, and I'm probably underestimating it by 50%. It has two large wicker padded chairs, a beautiful dining table, raised, under an enormous parasol, two recliners for sunbathing, and a very large jacuzzi. We spent more awake time outside in that terrace than we did inside the actual room.

This hotel was just a perfect choice for me: small and personalised, luxurious, extraordinary service, great room, and with awesome restaurant (even if you don't dine there, try their breakfast... I'm usually lukewarm about hotel breakfasts but this was mindblowing). Even the free wifi worked flawlessly (which is most hotels' daemon).

I very definitely recommend it.

Title: 5 star's accommodation
Text:
Perfect place for us to spend 4 night's in Barcelona
Very high quality of accommodation,  we were really impressed,  the room was perfect, small , cozy and with a very good wiew on the main street.
We wiil be back again
Its the best place to stay

Title: Good quality
Text:
Perfect accommodation, we spend 2 night's at Barcelona at ABaC hotel, very close to all main visit point, good price and good quality 
If we decide to visit again Barcelona we gonna choose the same accommodation

Title: Review
Text: Stayed at hotel and had lunch with reservations at restaurant. Hotel was lovely. Out of the way and just perfect. Reception upgraded us and provided two glasses of a very nice cava. Room was nice and bed was super comfy. Though no pool they have a great spa/sauna area. Only complaint was that there were additional taxes other hotels did not seem to have or charge. For lunch we had the mushroom gnocchi and though we ordered it as starter to be split they decided to give and charge for two portions vs one. One would be hard to split though. Had sea bass and pigeon. Presentation excellent and taste was even better. Worth the experience!

Title: LUXURY LIES IN THE DETAILS
Text:
A critical and negative review as the Abac has potential, is a beautiful boutique hotel, staff is lovely, but can’t be considered a top luxury hotel at all. 
I took the time to list all “details” that weren't quite right, and speak with staff and manager. This email went unanswered and nothing was taken into account aside from putting an ethernet cable (creating a working Wifi network was surely too much trouble). 

I first stayed at the Abac after opening 4 years ago, was impressed at the time ; they have since focused on the restaurant, led by a star Chef and likely more profitable. Much fewer staff was assigned to the hotel than at the time. 
Although hotels in Barcelona set the bar very low for such a popular destination, and have increased prices due to the fall of the Euro, the ranking of the Abac is very surprising. 
If you travel as a group, don’t need flexibility, can plan ahead, apartments are a much better option than hotels in this city, and many hotels are a better option than the Abac. 

You could still consider it if: 
you plan a short stay and don’t need Wifi 
you don’t need to come back often to your room (location is out of the way) 
you can afford a suite (rooms are small)
you aren’t fussy at all about details and don’t expect a 5*L experience à la Mandarin, Four Seasons etc. 

GENERAL 

Staff is efficient, smart, friendly and tries their best. 
Hotel was not sold out unlike most during this busiest season of the year, although their website gave no availability, you could always find rooms on 3rd party websites, which I think is not good practice. And despite “discounted rates”. 
There are reasons for that. 

Location is definitely out of the way and there is nothing around except the metro station going to the center. Yes, it’s only 15-30 min to Catalunya by metro (it runs every 15 min), but you think twice if you want to come back, esp at night. It's a 10-15€ taxi ride every time. 
The Abac could have made up for that by having maybe not a pool, but at least lounge chairs on the grounds. My terrace had none, which made it rather useless. 

The Abac should have a clear parking spot for taxis, and a bellboy. 
First impression upon arrival can be terrible, as you have no idea where to go - and although I’m a big boy, it felt awkward carrying all my luggage. Even coming to the restaurant gave a bad first impression to my guests, as they are lost between the several doors to get in what looks a bit like a fortress. 

ROOMS & SUITES
Very quiet (rare in Barcelona - no banging doors from 7AM as at the Mandarin). Great bed.
 
The largest, the Deluxe varies in size depending on the website, it is actually 31m2 and definitely not the 40m2 advertised by the hotel. Just one small closet… you will feel cramped as a couple and won’t be able to unpack. 
The superior with a terrace are the nicest for the outdoor space. 
I liked the Junior Suite I changed for, although the terrace is on a busy street, so it just works out for late night drinks. 
I was staying for 8 nights, so I would have appreciated a free (and spontaneous) upgrade since they had availability, and I had contacted SLH (which actually offer the upgrade) many times about that. 

REAL PROBLEMS
Main issue is Wifi was mostly not just slow, but non existent. They kindly offered to have a direct line installed to my room, which took 2 hours on the 3rd day; but their whole infrastructure needs to be revamped. Then, I had to go buy an adaptor myself and there was no actual Wifi, just an ethernet wire. Can’t move your laptop (desk was tiny) nor use Wifi on your phone. I explained, insisted about roaming charges, no one acted on it - or responded. 
Likewise, most hasn’t been replaced in 5 years and shows signs of wear and tear.  
The rain shower would flood the bathroom, started randomly at night sometimes, and both pressure and temperature changed dramatically. No one ever bothered to come back to me on this (very important) point. 
Bottled water is sorely missing (plan to buy some outside), minibar not replenished. 
Again, given the location, snacks should be offered during the day. 

FOOD
Breakfast is underwhelming, not on par with luxury hotels. It is brought to your table and doesn’t have enough choices. Served in the room, fresh orange juice was replaced by concentrated. I would write my choices by email, and they never got it perfectly right in 8 days. 
Room service menu is too limited. 
The restaurant: locals consider it very overpriced - the chef is the star of a TV Show. They all recommended to pass.

AMENITIES
There are none, except for a pricey spa. The gym they partnered with is awesome, 10 min walk, huge and clean. 
They charge 41€/day for parking, including scooters, which is absurd. 

INVOICE 
As expected, many undue charges. Not only did they charge my upgrade for more nights than I actually benefited from it (while I insisted it should be free with SLH), but breakfasts were randomly added. 
I would have come back as I like the "privacy" and boutique feel, but ... 
although I stayed for 8 nights, was one of the few guests, they never seemed to get what I liked "right", and I didn't appreciate having to ask all the time for anything, like getting glasses replaced, a pen, paper…  

Being nice isn't enough to run a luxury hotel, and 5*L guests come to these hotels precisely not have to bother about Wifi or the shower not working.

Title: Thank You Barcelona
Text: Well...good morning to every single reader. I'm reducing my text to a short conclusion: my favorite hotel in Europe! This place went beyond my expectations...congratulations. It worth every penny, no more innuendos, if you want not just a quiet luxury place, nisi a somewhere closer to 'home', just booking here...this is my second post of ABaC because I decided to be anew a guest very soon =D

Title: Excellence is what you will get
Text: This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at.  With only 15 rooms you will get top notch treatment and experience a truly phenomenal hotel with maybe the best restaurant in Barcelona!  This is a great location as well and close to the mountains where you will have spectacular views.

Title: Great Stay!
Text:
Our stay was outstanding.  The location is perfect in a quiet residential area.  The staff, Javier, Irene, Mar, Caroline, Pinar were fabulous.  Loved the room with the curtain and separate seating area.  We had dinner and it was extraordinary and so was the price.  Every dish of our 18 course meal was exquisite, for us, a once in a lifetime experience.  We loved the spa, with the lounges in the water and heated beds.  Breakfast was fabulous!

There are a couple opportunities for improvement, however, mostly mechanical or maintenance related.  The lighting in the hallway (where closets, drawers and safe were located) was insufficient at best and would automatically shut off while working in the area.  These details did not detract from our overall experience, but seemed contrary to the high level of service and execution in every other area.  

It occured to me that perhaps a better experience for the romantic rose petal whirlpool bath might be to schedule some private time in the spa.  It was extremely enjoyable and appeared to be underutilized.

In summary, our stay at ABaC was outstanding and a highlight of our trip.

Title: Second time to stay at ABAC, and looking forward to go back again.
Text: This is our second time to stay at ABAC, I have to say compared with 2 years ago, they have improved a lot, the housekeeping was flawless, very pleasant and cosy stay, very quiet and away from the crowd, but just 2 mins walk to metro station, takes 10- 15 mins to the city centre. Can't wait to go back again.

Title: Luxury Hotel
Text:
ABaC Hotel in Barcelona is one of those hotels where you don't have to worry about anything going wrong or being out of place. It's furnishings are beautiful and the staff are very friendly and welcoming. 
The rooms are amazing and the beds were massive, plus use of the spa which is nice. 

It is situated perfectly to either catch bus, underground or taxi all 3 are a matter of 1 minute walk from the gate and can take you all over the city for reasonably small amount. 
If you are looking for luxury in Barcelona this is seriously one to consider.

Title: Private slice of paradise
Text: We have now stayed twice at the ABaC. Barcelona is a wonderful city to visit and the ABaC has provided us with a quiet and private respite.  The staff are helpful and friendly.  The rooms beautifully appointed and quiet.  Ours had a large terrace overlooking the adjacent park and lower lawn of the restaurant.  The restaurant is fantastic and we had one of our best meals there.  It is located at the end of metro line 7. A direct route to down town.

Title: A Perfect Stay!!
Text: The hotel was wonderful & in a great location for the hop on/hop off bus. There was a supermarket within walking distance & the neighborhood felt safe & removed from the typical tourist traffic. The staff was more than accommodating & catered to our every need. The room was comfortable, the terrace gorgeous & the food (for both breakfast & from the room service menu) was delicious! Will definitely stay again & would recommend without hesitation.

Title: Quintessential Boutique Hotel Experience
Text:
We stayed at ABaC for two nights. The place is fantastic from a design, furnishing, and amenities perspective. The restaurant (reviewed separately) was nothing short of amazing. We also made use of the spa, which was okay.

The whole experience epitomizes the small luxury hotel experience. That said, ABaC's location is a little isolated, with very few restaurants within walking distance, so you need to take the Metro to access everything else Barcelona has to offer.

Title: Very beautyfool,  Excellent !!!
Text: Very beautyfool,  Excellent !!! I have seen many beautiful hotels in the world. This hotel is one of the best! almost all admirable! I thank the owners and staff for a memorable location in their beautiful paradise! I will definitely recommend it to friends, and more than once he beats them!

Title: NO Wow Factor !
Text: To be fair to this hotel the welcome was friendly, (we were offered drinks on arrival) - although a little unusual as we had to use an intercom to get inside the premises.  It is located on the corner of two very busy roads which initially worried me but sound proofing in the hotel was good. We disliked having to walk through the busy kitchen to reach our room, and thought this was inappropriate for a five star hotel. The room was of a high standard but small. Fixtures and fittings modern as expected it was nice to have a nespresso machine. We didn't eat in the restaurant as we went into Barcelona for the three evenings we were there.  The distance into Barcelona is about 20 minutes by taxi, (approx 10 euros)  - so don't book this hotel expecting to walk straight into the  center of Barcelona. Breakfast was included but we found it to be inconsistent, first morning no menu, no eggs, just fruit and pastries, second morning we were offered eggs, third morning, we had a menu and eggs. Service adequate but not particularly personable.  Disaster with parking - hotel charges 41 Euros, per night, we were told it was OK to park in street, but we were towed from outside the hotel. On departure the hotel contributed 100 euros towards our 200 euro recovery cost.  The whole experience was disappointing.

Title: Family vacation
Text: Though small it is an amazing hotel very clean and its restaurant has the best food I have every eaten in my life and one of the most friendly people that you will ever come across I had the most amazing Time can't wait to go back

Title: Must get the room with the Garden Terrace!
Text:
Neighborhood:  beautiful, leafy, stately neighborhood just outside the center of the city.  But just a 10 minute metro ride to Placa Catalunya, so extremely convenient to almost anything.

Terrace: We had one of the rooms with an outdoor garden terrace.  This absolutely made the trip.  The terrace garden was larger than the room itself and it was absolutely gorgeous and full of flowers.

Shower: rainfall shower was outstanding, and strong pressure.

Restaurant: See separate review but absolutely outstanding. Interestingly, when you get out of the elevator on the main floor, you walk directly through the kitchen (of a two star Michelin restaurant) on your way to the lobby!

Service: Very helpful staff.

Title: VIP treatment is a free beer with terrible service
Text:
The good:  beautifully designed hotel, very quite, amazing food and good location if you like to be a bit removed from the center a nice SPA and one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in
The bad: too many sacrifices of functionality for design, bathroom is beautiful but the sink does not fully empty, the shower has little pressure and will drizzle for hours after usage, furniture slowly falling apart, the iPad is the first edition and there fore useless as the browser is from 5 years ago, and it is poorly cleaned.
The ugly: service is terrible from all points of view not even close to a five star. To date I have refrained from reviewing hotels as I travel a lot also for work thought it could become a full time job.... But this time I really felt poorly treated.  Started with the emails to organize the week end with awful customer service. I was initially told that I could only have dinner at the Michelin starred restaurant at a ridiculous time.  Only after explaining with decisive tones that I had chosen the hotel for the restaurant was I given a choice.  Minimal help in getting things organized in Barcelona and most time not even done right.  On Friday there was no booking at the restaurant we where sent to.  My wife asked for a hairdresser and was quoted 136€ when she got there there was no reservation and was charged 46€!  Pick up was late at the airport and 3 times the cost of taxi. And to top it off I got an email promising a VIP treatment that resulted in a free beer at a restaurant belonging to the same people!!!! Being a patron does not even come close to paying off, we had booked 4 massages, had booked both restaurante and an airport pick up and had breakfast in room everyday... Well all we got is terrible is terrible service.  And there is more examples like breakfast never served at the requested time, taxis called from far away (they do not tell you that they can be graves from in front of the hotel, calls in the room to claim back the breakfast tray, no newspapers etc..). To think that I took the time to drop the man email explaining it was my wedding anniversary...What a pity because with professionals this would be a fantastic hotel.  If they had on tenth of the passion in the hotel service as in the food of the restaurant this would be perfect
I am never coming back and SLH should be ware!!!  And I waited 48hrs to cool off before writing the review...
And of course when we left no one bothered to ask how our stay was.... Maybe Easter week end they had the good staff on holiday?

Title: Amazing Stay in Barcelona
Text: We have been for two nights in Abac Hotel for the first time. We have been in many hotels in Barcelona and we can say that is the Best Hotel in Barcelona. The rooms are gorgeous, we have been in two diferent rooms and the decoration and the materials are very nice.One of the rooms had a great balcony.The rooms smells amazing. The bed is the most confortable of the other hotels, it seems like in heaven. The linen are from very high quality.The pillows are the best ones. The bathrooms are plain of Hermés amenities. There is all very clean: tables, floor, night tables, bath, shower, windows...The curtains are moderns, and there are no walls with the street, but you can not hear any noise neither from the street nor from other rooms. People who work there are extreamly friendly, a very great staff. There is a huge spa that offer different treatments. The breakfast is incredible, we have had the best orange juice ever and the pastry is home made. We strongly recommend to stay in Abac Hotel to have a nice stay and dont fail with the election.

Title: Wow from start to finish
Text: Had an amazing stay at the ABaC Barcelona hotel (as well as an amazing meal at the restaurant). We had a deluxe room and it had floor-to-ceiling windows on three sides (with wood slats outside and drapes for privacy) but the amount of natural light during the daytime was outstanding. In addition breakfast (definitely opt in) was a treat with personalized service and order options. Then there was the relaxing spa facility that was also complimentary. And in terms of location it was at a great spot right across the street from both a metro station and a taxi stand. The staff was lovely, the beds were comfortable, and the rainshower and heated towel racks were perfect. Can't say enough nice things about this hotel!

Title: Faultless luxury !!
Text:
this has to be honestly one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in.
The decor is beautiful and very tastefully blended with the old buildings.
The bed is superb and loving the jacuzzi, shower cube what a great idea for a wet room.
Staff were hugely helpful, very polite.
Business trip this time but definitely returning with the wife
Very much top end class about the whole place

Title: When dining at ABaC, stay the night
Text:
The rooms are superb. They are beautifully furnished, the bed is divine, and the bathroom is top. The cleaning and the turn down service are excellent. The breakfast (no buffet) is abundant and delicious. The spa is great. The metro station Tibidabo is close to the hotel and it takes 12 minutes to get to Las Ramblas. 
The bar of the hotel is beautiful but cold and without staff or guests. You don’t have the impression of staying in a hotel. At check-in you get your key card; at check-out you pay the bill. 
I would recommend this hotel to stay overnight when dining in Abac restaurant, not for a longer stay. For 350 €/night  you have plenty of choices in Barcelona.

Title: Contemporaray elegance
Text: ABaC Hotel is a small, contemporary elegant hotel located in a park setting.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  The room was comfortable with a full terrace with no perceptible street noise.  Fantastic breakfast!

Title: amazing 5 stars hotel
Text: this fabulous hotel is near the famous tibidabo district but not so far from the city, surrounded by a beautiful garden, you will not hear any noise in the spacious modern suites and you should try at least the restaurant one time which is one of the best of barcelona

Title: A hidden gem
Text:
I was visiting Barcelona to collect my wedding dress from Sabadell and needed somewhere convenient to stay so I could have my final dress fitting and then collect the dress the following day. I have visited Barcelona several times before and love the city, however I chose ABaC due to it's convenient location rather than as a tourist... plus, I wanted to enjoy my stay and it seemed much nicer than most of the hotels located nearer to Sabadell.

ABaC offers luxury in a modern setting. This boutique-hotel felt much more like staying at a friend's (super impressive, well designed) house, than at a "hotel", especially when walking through the Michelin-kitchen to access my room! From the private gate access, to the receptionist greeting me as soon as I'd parked my car, the entire stay was very personal and felt well-tailored to suit each guest's needs. The entire place just felt tranquil and calm.

Staying in the Superior room, with its elongated balcony is highly recommended as this was a very enjoyable space for quietly reading my book and using my laptop. The room itself was a little small, but perfectly comfortable. The bed was incredibly comfortable for a peaceful night's sleep and the bathroom was great too, especially when trying the Hermes toiletries. Everything appeared suitably clean, except when I accidentally dropped a piece of jewellery behind the dresser and so I noticed it was rather grim and dusty in the hidden areas.

Staff were consistently very friendly and professional. I did have one small issue upon calling to request a socket adapter, as after an hour's wait I ended up having to call again to follow-up, and subsequently one was swiftly brought to my room.

I did not get the chance to enjoy the apparently magnificent restaurant at the hotel during my stay simply because I'm not well accustomed to dining alone in public, especially if enjoying such an impressive meal. I did however get to enjoy a fantastic room service dinner, which I found to be surprisingly affordable, considering the restaurant it was served by (again, the balcony was the ideal space for enjoying the meal). Breakfast was also as good as expected with a small menu selection to choose from.

All in all, an incredibly comfortable and enjoyable stay. I would certainly consider staying at ABaC again.

Title: Feeling smart?
Text: Away from the crowds, yet easily accessible, the ABaC Barcelona can leave you feeling very pleased with yourself. It is undeniably chic but understated and friendly. You enter an oasis of calm through a door from the street on a busy intersection. All is calm. Our room was modern and (but) comfortable with nice touches and treats. Oh and if you don't fancy any of the generously given recommendations from the front desk, well it is also home to a Michelin two starred restaurant. Who said hotel food always disappoints?!

Title: Amazing
Text: Fantastic service, amazing food, sublime rooms / beds and beautiful facial and massage. I cannot fault ABaC. It was heaven. From the minute I was asked at the check in desk if I would like a glass of cava I knew I would not want to leave and I didn't. I was so relaxed and happy when I left - it was worth every cent. The staff make this place even more spectacular - nothing was too much trouble and there manner was gentle and efficient. Excellent!

Title: Beautiful hotel
Text: My only regret about staying at the ABAC hotel was that it was for only one night. The reservation process was made simple by Roberto who was very helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful and the service was incredible you rarely see places like this in Europe where you have immaculate service, rooms and facilities all in one place. Our room was a deluxe room which was beautifully furnished very modern and sleek. Loved the black out blinds and all the B&O equipment. The bathroom and amenities were fantastic a fabulous rain shower with a jacuzzi bath tub as well. The bed is very comfortable and made for a great sleep. The hotel is close to all attractions in barcelona took us about 10/15 minutes to get to most sites. Along with hermes toiletries which was a fantastic touch. Truly a gem of a hotel. We didn't have an opportunity to dine at the hotels restaurant as they were fully booked but we were given a tour of the kitchen the smell and food did look amazing. The spa at the hotel is amazing as well. Definitely will be staying for longer next time. Absolutely amazing hotel.

Title: Amazing food, super slick operation
Text:
We stayed for 2 nights in Jan 15 taking the Gourmet Experience on offer which included the larger tasting menu at the restaurant.  We also opted for the wines to accompany each course.

The food was outstanding and very interesting, just about all the dishes were a hit with both of us and the wines were perfect.  The staff too were great, nothing too much trouble and the service was very very slick and professional.

Room (standard double) was quite big actually and had everything you needed.  Would've liked one or two UK channels on the TV, even just BBC News, but it was nice not to watch TV at all for a few days to be honest.  Shower very good and LED lighting in the jacuzzi bath as well as remote control blinds and decent A/C.

Breakfast was really excellent, the fruit salad with basil sorbet so fresh and def try the egg cooked at low temp with pomme puree - delicious.  Coffee and pastries and hams if you like - you won't go hungry!

Location is just to the NW of the city and only 10E from the city centre in a cab.  We jumped on the tourist bus right outside to get a feel for the whole city which was great.  Also a station right outside but we didn't use it.

Airport is about 20 mins away and cost around 35E in taxi.

All in all would go back in a heartbeat if staying in Barcelona.  Thank you ABaC.

Title: Unique and One of a Kind Hotel
Text: My wife and I stayed at ABaC and we were quite impressed with just about everything!  Very friendly and professionally trained staff settle you in from the moment you arrive at the premise.  The room was beautifully decorated and the bed was extra comfy compared to the other hotels we stayed in Barcelona.  It's well known restaurant did not disappoint as we were quite impressed with food and we cannot wait to go back for another experience very soon!

Title: Wonderful Hotel, Outstanding Service
Text:
We recently completed our third stay at ABaC and plan to visit again next year. Obviously, we have had good experiences and have enjoyed the hotel, the restaurant, and Barcelona. Our first visit was for just a couple nights and mainly was to give us a place to stay while dining in the restaurant. On our arrival we were greeted warmly and efficiently. After a glass of cava, we were shown to our room (very nice, modern, and comfortable in the new building) and napped for a few hours (after an overnight flight from Washington, DC). As it was Sunday and most restaurants were close, the staff suggested several tapas places, which turned out to be great. We had reservations at a couple restaurants, which the hotel confirmed. In addition, they suggested sightseeing activities and made reservations for us. We had dinner in the restaurant, which completely lives up to the Michelin stars. (If you do the tasting menu, be prepared for many courses of avante guarde cooking. We found some more to our taste than others, but that is what we expect when we dine with a young, creative chef.) This visit was wonderful and we decided to return the next year.

On our second visit we were welcomed as warmly as on our first. We were given a room in the older building that was very nice and had a lot of character. However, this visit showed a lot about the hotel staff’s character. On the third (of seven) days my wife became quite ill. I spoke with the person at reception and within about an hour a doctor arrived. He turned out to be fantastic (Barcelonadoctors.com). He suggested hospitalization, but we decided to wait the night, which turned out fine. However, I then became sick. Thus most of the time we were in our room. The staff was genuinely concerned. We were able to get a special menu that the doctor suggested and they went out for prescriptions that the doctor ordered. As far as I could tell we were only charged for the price of the prescriptions. Certainly this is over and beyond what one could expect. 

A year later (in late November) we returned hoping to see and do things we had not been able to do because of our illnesses. We were greeted as old friends and treated as family. What a great time. However, this visit showed something more about the hotel. During our stay they were having some painting done. This resulted in an odor in our room. When I mentioned this at reception, our room was immediately changed. What more can one ask? 

The hotel is located in a residential area, but a subway is almost at their front door and easily connects to downtown. After staying in ABaC I cannot imagine a more peaceful and convenient location. We particularly enjoyed a small park that is right next door. In addition there is a taxi stand just across the street, so we never worried about transportation. 

The web site accurately portrays the hotel and restaurant. We have stayed in both the new and the older buildings and have enjoyed both. Believe the pictures and description on the web.

Title: Wonderfull stay in charming hotel with great cuisine
Text: We had one night away with à gourmetmenu by chef Jordi Cruz. We were received very personally by nice staf and got à tour of the spa and kitchen. The room in the new part was spacious, modern with à good rainshower. They take good care of all details, discrete and attentive. Dinner at the restaurant was special, so many amazing tastes and good wine. We had à wonderfull and relaxend night away.

Title: Excellent
Text: Wow, I went there on the 19th of December. I stayed there for one night, I wish I would have stayed longer. I didn't know it was going to be such a pleasant stay. From the very start staff were extremely kind and helpful. They showed me around the hotel and they gave me an excellent room with a huge beautiful terrace thanks to the manager. She was really kind. Wonderful. The receptionist too. They take good care of every detail. I forgot my hairbrush and I was thinking about going out to buy one when I saw there was one in the bathroom! There is also a magnificent spa that you can use if you need to relax and the atmosphere is nice and quiet. The restaurant is wonderful too, great service, excellent food and a unique experience worth having. I was able to congratulate the great chef Jordi Cruz and I will be back there soon, no doubt. Even though I had dinner alone I didn't feel strange at all. They know what they are doing and I can only congratulate them. Honestly, if you ever visit Barcelona, don't miss it. A 5 star stay. I will also rate the restaurant.

Title: AMAZING AND UNFORGETTABLE
Text:
The room was very harmonious,peaceful and soundproofed.Wide spaces allow you to move easily even if you have 2 luggages. The bathroom in just amazing. Very clean, big shower and with a "woman kit" or "man kit" with toothbrush, smoother and even a brush! In the closet you have all you need if you want to go in the SPA of the hotel ( RECCOMENDED!!!) 
High leveled staff wich help you at every time of the day or night. The breakfast is delicious!!! 
If you stay at this hotel you HAVE TO TRY the restaurant and the SPA! The restaurant is lead by the famous chef Jordy Cruz wich can offer an unforgettable tasty-experience in the city.
The hotel is well located. Subway and bus stop in front of it allow you to get to the center easy and in few minutes.
I hope to come back soon in Barcelona for staying in this amazing place!

Title: Excellent time at a great boutique hotel
Text: A great hotel to stay at in Barcelona.  The restaurant has excellent service, great wines and unique food.  The hotel rooms are well appointed, spacious, and very comfortable to stay in. Oasis/spa like environment throughout the hotel.  All staff truly cared about the guest's experience.  It is a bit out of the city but close to Carretera de les Aigües where there is excellent mountain biking for all levels and great views of the city.

Title: Neighborhood Gem!
Text: Perfect service, room had plenty of space to spread out, and the chef on hand is AMAZING!  If you are wanting to stay in a boutique hotel, somewhere you can retreat too after your wonderful day in the city, away from the noise, this is perfect for you!!  5 star service all around!  best price you will find in barcelona for most amount of space in your hotel room!  Cab ride away from everything.  Absolutely try out the Spa, bring some wine, and enjoy while you are there!

Title: The most amazing hotel experience!
Text: My husband and I celebrated his 41st birthday by staying in this hotel and dining at the restaurant. The room and service experience here, was flawlessly perfect. We were far enough from the city center to relax and close enough to get the full Barcelona experience. This was our second trip to Barcelona and too bad we didn't discover this place earlier. I cannot wait to return and stay here again. Words cannot express the hotel's perfection.

Title: ABaC is first class
Text: From the moment you approach ABaC this is a hotel apart. Helpful staff see you being dropped off at the entrance and meet you to take your bags. You sit at reception in comfortable chairs, you don't stand. The rooms are beautifully designed and appointed. Sit in the garden and enjoy a genuine oasis in the city. Breakfast is to die for. If you can find a reason to visit ABaC you must go.

Title: Abac hotel
Text: Loved our little boutique hotel. There are only 15 rooms so everyone on staff knows you personally during your stay. The concierge provides excellent service and recommendations for sights...AND THE FOOD AT ABAC IS AMAZING. One of top two meals we've ever had! Also, check out the spa and massage if you get a chance. It is very small so it is more like a private area for you only.

Title: First class
Text:
I've just been checking my contributions and realised I never reviewed this hotel.  I stayed here a while ago so will keep it brief.

Hotel is located in a lovely upmarket area of Barcelona.  Not particularly central but very close to a metro stop and it takes no time to get to the centre.

Room was outstanding. Very spacious with quality bed linen and furnishings.  Lovely to have a separate dressing room.  Bathroom fully equipped with excellent rain shower and Hermes toiletries.  Rooms were also very quiet, our room had a corridor separating it from others.

My partner was unwell while we stayed and management did everything they could to help us.  They arranged a doctor and asked at regular intervals if there was anything we needed brought to the room.

I would thoroughly recommend this hotel as a base for Barcelona.

Title: Oasis in the city
Text: I have stayed at other nice properties in Barcelona, but after eating at ABaC restaurant, I was intrigued by the hotel.  It is fabulous!  The rooms, like rest of the hotel, are sleek and modern.  They have remote controls to open and close the curtains ....from bed!  The service is flawless, and breakfasts in the garden are just idyllic.  It is not centrally located, but it is not difficult to get anywhere in Barcelona from the hotel.  The spa is also a treat... Had one of the best facials during our stay.  We loved it and cannot wait to go back to ABaC!

Title: Great hotel, Great Location and fantastic staff
Text:
We have just completed a 4 night stay in the penthouse. On our arrival to the hotel we were early for check in by 3 hours. Luckily our room was ready and we had no issues checking in. We were greeted in reception by a very helpful lady who went through the map of Barcelona, highlighting which areas were worth checking out. Our bags were taken to our room and we were shown around the hotel, given a guided tour showing us the spa, the eating areas and even walking us through the kitchen to go to our part of the building.

Seeing the kitchen with a massive selection of chefs on hand was an experience and it had a real buzz to it. Once shown to our room, we were then show how to operate all lights, tv, shower etc which again was nice to have.

The room was lovely and had a great terrace area with an outdoor jacuzzi. We only had a free little niggles from the room which didn't overly affect our stay but based on the price paid and the 5 star status, really these should have been looked at. the taps in the bathroom were loose, the wiring cupboard didn't shut properly, the curtain were broken slightly at the top which we had to try and prop up to stop the light coming in. The outdoor table and parasol only had one chair so we had to take out on each night from the room and take back indoor each night. The first night the tv didn't work, we called down to reception and housekeeping came up immediately to try and fix, then maintenance tried too. The TV was fixed the next day and on the night it didn't work management sent us up a free bottle of wine for the inconvenience. This we thought was a lovely gesture and just one area where the staff went the extra mile.

Each night housekeeping came up to the room with a chocolate each and turned over the corners of the bed and provided a towel for by our bed. Asking if we needed anything extra e.g towels.This was another example of adding extra luxury to the experience.

We were provided with swipe cards to get into our room, this also was used to get into the gates of the hotel and the building of the hotel. This added extra security to the guests stopping which was nice. 

We didn't try the breakfast because 31 euros each is quite expensive so we went across to the pastry shop each day which cost no more than 5 euros each. We didn't try the restaurant either for dinner so we cannot comment on the food.

The penthouse suite was sound proofed and was a blessing as sometimes you can hear the traffic and busses outside. The hotel is situated near a train station and also 2 sightseeing busses which is very handy. 

The room and hotel was very clean and every day we awaited a set of towels on our sun loungers in addition to the ones in the bathroom. These towels came in handy when using the jacuzzi. 

If we visited Barcelona again we would stop in the hotel again as it was a lovely place to stay and the friendly and helpful staff make the experience an enjoyable one. I would love to give 5 stars for the hotel and it was very close to 5 stars but just those few minor things need to be fixed and then it would be perfect.

Title: A luxury hotel in every aspect
Text:
Having seen this hotel was rated as one of the best in Barcelona on Tripadvisor I was sceptical that it would live up to expectations, but it really was quite superb. There is a gated entry on arrival whereby you are required to buzz to enter (on subsequent trips you can use a keycard which is also the one which is used to access the other sections of the hotel like rooms and spa). This instantly gives the hotel a very private feel, secluded from the busy streets outside. 

The hotel is not located in the city centre however there is a metro station right outside whereby you can easily access everywhere you need to go. The metro system is straightforward when you become used to it, but slightly confusing to begin with. You need to buy the ticket named 't-10' which is better value than the single tickets as it offers you 10 trips. Ask any of the hotel staff or station staff they are very helpful.

We booked the hotel through SLH and reserved a deluxe room in hope we would be upgraded to their suite. On arrival we learned that they had two different types of suite, large and small. The large suits where unavailable so we asked to view their small suite and compare it to the deluxe room which they had no problem in accommodating. We chose the suite as it had a more spacious feel, with two living areas. 

The beds are amazing. Full stop. The room was well presented, very quiet, with good contemporary design.

We didn't eat at the restaurant apart from at breakfast but even then we could understand the reasons why this restaurant is so talked about. Breakfast consisted of orange juice, yoghurt and a selection of fresh fruit with basil sorbet, any you can pick any extras from their menu like pasty selections or eggs. 

As for the hotel's staff: They were extremely helpful, polite, calm and professional with excellent knowledge of the city. It seemed like they were eager to go the extra mile to please you. The lady who served us breakfast both mornings was very friendly and treated us like family rather than hotel guests. I believe her name was Pilar.

The spa was superb, as was the steam room and the massage beds in the water. The whole hotel has such a upmarket feel but this really was the icing on the cake.

One thing which became slightly tedious was having to keep walking through the kitchen to reach downstairs unless you wanted to go directly outside however it was nice to see the food being prepared in what was clearly a top class kitchen.

Overall, an amazing experience in a hotel truly worthy of it's reputation. A good way to experience Barcelona.

Title: Luxuriously Comfortable in an Elegant Neighborhood
Text: My disabled mother and my two sisters and I stayed at ABaC in September. We had two lovely suites, each generously sized with its own sitting area and luxury bath. The layout of the hotel is rather like a maze because it is retro-fitted from an old mansion. However, we managed to get around even with my mother's electric scooter. The staff is outstanding. My mother's walker was lost during our flights. When I asked about where to find one to purchase, I was personally escorted by a delightful gentleman across the street to the Farmacia where I was able to find a replacement. Sadly, the restaurant was closed on the Monday we were there, but we enjoyed cocktails, coffee and a delightful breakfast in a dining room overlooking the garden area. We did not take advantage of the spa services, but the soaking pool looked and smelled decadent. I highly recommend and hope to stay here again.

Title: Great people, nice location
Text:
We stayed for three nights at the end of September.  The staff is wonderful - particularly the woman who worked breakfast each of the mornings we were there.  The location is great - it is nice to be able to get away from the crazy of downtown.

While I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again and I do strongly recommend it, there are some minor negatives to point out.  We stayed in room 814 - there was a fair amount of noise each night (we think from the kitchen just below us) every night until between 12 and 1.  The sink is a modern design that doesn't really drain; the shower can't be turned on without getting wet; the sitting room and bedroom TVs respond to the same remote, so if you do something in one room it changes the setting in the other.  It isn't like we were really there for TV, so it wasn't a big deal - but things should work.

Do stay there - you will love it - but be prepared for it to be a bit short of perfect - or be better at asking for help than we were!

Title: They made the most important day of our life perfect
Text:
Got married in Barcelona on the 31 of July 2014.
We stayed in the penthouse-suite for the night and had our weddingparty in the restaurant.
Will not even bother to go in to details about the meal. We had great expectations but this went beyond all of them. The room was A+. Not the normal "5star" with the cheap solutions as you often see in this range of hotels. This was 5 star in a way that most hotels should not dear dream of.

But what stands out is the service and the dedication from the staff. We can not thank you enough.
You dont get to test your flow in the kitchen and waitstaff before you serve a halfdrunk norwegian wedding with 10 speaches that mess up your routine. 

Thank you Jordi Cruz for the perfect meal,
but most of all THANK YOU CRISTINA.
You made our wedding!

Title: Beautiful property, pleasant stay
Text: My wife and I stayed here for three nights and were in a room with a large outdoor patio. The room was extremely nice, including the bathroom, and the patio was a  huge plus, as we ate breakfast out there every morning.   The staff was extremely engaged and helpful.  The location is great, as it is a quick ride on the L7 line into the center of town, but it is quiet up the hill at the hotel.   We used room service many times and it worked great.   We did book well ahead and that seemed to give us a great price on a room -- just an observation.  The airport is about 20 minutes by taxi.  Definitely a great choice for a Barcelona stay!

Title: Oasis in Barcelona
Text: I real gem in a busy city, the Abac really delivers on its promise of a boutique hotel. Set outside the city centre the staff recommended the metro for getting around, with a very nearby station it proved a great way of getting around. The room was very spacious and luxurious with an amazing bathroom. The hotel feels very intimate and quiet with the restaurant something really special and well worth a visit.

Title: Pulled all the right faces, but forgot to sweat
Text:
The title of our review is a saying that means that someone put in the appearance of doing something, but with no real care or effort - this was our experience at ABaC. Here is the list of things that were sub-standard for a luxury hotel:
In our room, the front door lock, curtains and tv were all malfunctioning - none of which were fixed during our three day stay (in fact staff simply said "we know" as if nothing could be done).
In our room the shower walls and ceiling had mould growing on them as did the hand basin; the backing was peeling off the curtains, some of which were partially hanging off the rails.
The door to our corridor was chocked open as the locking mechanism was broken (and had been for some time).
The "concierge" had no tourist information, recommendations for restaurants outside the hotel and could not supply a map of Barcelona.
When asked if we could get more milk for the coffee machine (two small pods were supplied) - we were told "no" as it is "complementary". We purchased our own at a local store at 12 for 60 cents.
On the last day there was mould on my brioche at breakfast.

We cannot recommend this hotel and would not stay again.

Title: our stay at the ABaC Barcelona
Text: We stayed in ABaC restaurant & Hotel for 3 nights.  Our stay at this hotel was excellent from the time of check-in; when Roberto welcomed us and explained all about the hotel and about some of the tourist attractions in the city, right up to the time we left the hotel.  We would recommend the full breakfast which was excellent and the lady that served was very helpful, unfortunately the restaurant was closed while were staying. Although on the outskirts of the city the hotel was adjacent to the metro which took you into the city centre in a matter of minutes, beside a tour-bus stopping point and beside the "Blue Tram" stop which took you to the funicular railway  We would definitely come back and we would make sure it was at a time the restaurant was open. thank-you to all at ABaC

Title: Great place
Text: Very modern and comfortable place to stay, a block away from the train station to La Rambla. In a busy area, but the rooms are quiet. Shower was amazing. My wife and her parents enjoyed massages in the spa. There is no lap pool, just a wading pool in the spa. The main focus of the hotel is the restaurant which has two Michelin stars and is fantastic. Hotel, facility, and restaurant staff were all very pleasant and helpful.

Title: First Impression
Text:
Dear Hotel Manager, 

Hope you are doing well. 

We have just checked in to our room and looking forward to experience ABaC services for our last destination for this summer trip. 

We are in wedding & event planning industry for the pass ten years in Asia and would like to share a little feedback about our experience with your team. 

Upon our arrival at hotel, we are trying to intercom with your team about that we got 6pcs luggage. One of your team member come and help out but i do not think that she are able to handle it as all luggages are heavy. We are offering whether there is a trolley or male colleague could help. At the end, both us need to handle another 2 luggage and some paper bags. One of the luggage fall down and knock on my feet, im standing there and non of your team members offer any help to ease the situation. Im really disappointed with this.

When we checking in at the reception desk, receptionist would like to get our passport and we have mentioned that could we do it later after i have unpack my luggage. The receptionist insist us to present the passport. One of your team member saw the situation and offer us to do it after we check into our room.

The receptionist didn't get my name correct on the check in form. Its appear Steven and there is not even my email address. I have received several email from your hotel and keep remind me that we are one of your important guests. Your team will give us all help whenever we ask, but it seem like i didn't experienced any VIP treatment since my check in. 

When im at your front desk and ask for whether hotel provide any complimentary bottle water and the respond that i got is a word" NO " . We have work with luxurious hotel around the world and always understand that hotel policy may vary. But customer services should be equal to your hotel standard when handling customer inquiries. 

One last thing, we didn't receive any welcome gift in our room. Through our event experiences for the pass few years, customer commitment should be the core value in every hotel. 

Hope our feedback will bring up a discussions in your team and looking forward to the rest of our staty.

Title: Beautiful
Text: .My partner and I arrived at the ABaC hotel looking forward to a fantastic holiday in this wonderful hotel. We weren't disappointed. It is truly amazing. Staff who are attentive without being pretentious. Our check in was a relaxing and very welcoming experience..Thankyou Christina for making us feel so special.. our room was beautiful with the most amazing Tv I have ever seen. We were greeted each morning by the lady serving breakfast (Pilar) I think was her name. Sooo friendly .We had the pleasure of eating in the restaurant on Tuesday evening. WHAT AN EXPERIENCE.  The most spectacular food I have ever tasted. Thank you to (Mar) who waited on us the entire evening.  The only down side and its a very small down side was the fact that I had booked us in for 4days with a continental breakfast. This meant for 4 mornings we had fruit,orange juice and a selection of breads. If we wanted cooked food it meant we paid another 31 euro each every day. A liitle steep. The hotel is very convenient to the tourist bus stop and also the tram which takes you up to the most amazing views over Barcelona.  All in all we had the most relaxing break we could have wished for and hope to return, Thankyou team ABac.

Title: Very Special Place
Text:
My daughter and I only spent one night (sadly) at this marvelous gem of a hotel in Barcelona. 
It is located in a lovely neighborhood; we were so pleased the moment our taxi pulled up and we discovered this perfect spot. As we had just flown in and it was a bit late, we immediately got seated in their smaller dining room and had a very special dinner. Most original food presentation and very tasty. Then we were escorted to our room, which was beautifully designed, immaculate, and very fashionable. I would love to design my own bathroom at home like this. Latest (it seemed to me) European modern elegant design, materials, great shower, beautiful sink, tub, etc. Just a lovely place. We also had a nice breakfast in a pretty enclosed garden in the morning. Want to go back!!

Title: A small jewel in a beautiful city
Text:
I spent one night (only unfortunately) at ABaC and it was a great experience. This small hotel has great rooms, services, and the quality of the food is outstanding. I did not have the opportunity to enjoy the restaurant because it was the weekly day close, but I experienced the room service with great aperitiv and snacks and breakfast in the morning.
The room is really nice with outstanding bathroom and high quality furnitures.
The personnel is keen to protect the privacy as well as the location and the way to access the hotel makes it a perfect choice for persons want to keep a low-profile and defend the its own privacy.
Service is accurate and gentle.
The only negative note is about the price that is in the high-range for such class of hotels.

Title: the best experience of my life
Text:
this hotel when you arrive its in the best location, but it looks very much hidden behind a high fence, exclusive is the definitely  the word. inside is perfection. the staff how ever are polite and highest service with out being snooty.
the famous chef Jordi cruz you will see sitting with guests, his food is the best you will ever try in your life.

the cost is totally within reach and so much worth every single penny. will i go back, too right i will
the best place to visit for a short break or long. the spa is award winning.

Title: Incredible
Text:
I was taken here for my birthday recently as a surprise. The treat was the 16 course menus with the wine pairings and a night at the hotel. Wow. 

The room was very well decorated with a separate bedroom, amazing bathroom with a giant tub and a phenomenal shower that was like standing in a hot rain storm. The bed was incredibly comfortable (especially after the 4 hour lunch) and the living room very comfortable.  I loved the whole experience. 

The hotel is in a very quiet posh neighbourhood with a trolley in front that runs up to the funicular railway to the top of Tibidabo. There are some fun bars near the top but very little else around though the Metro is close by.

Title: Wonderful boutique hotel
Text: This small boutique hotel was wonderful.  From the minute we checked in, everyone made sure our stay was perfect.  They made reservations of us at local restaurants, arranged tours and site seeing, and helped us as we checked out and discovered the rental car agency had no more cars even though we had a confirmation of reservation..  They went above and beyond to get us to our next location.  The rooms were wonderful and very quiet and luxurious! The restaurant was fabulous and it was our highlight meal while in Barcelona.  We are so happy we spent 5 days enjoying this hotel!

Title: Best ever experience
Text:
We stayed for just one night , wish so much we booked for longer . I can not recommend  the hotel and restraunt more .
We had the grand ABaC , a 16 course meal , it was incredible , my taste buds were taken to places I have never experienced .
